description: Test your knowledge of Jesus' teachings on prayer

options.explanation: The Lord's Prayer begins with 'Our Father in heaven'.
The Lord's Prayer doesn't begin with 'Heavenly King'.
The Lord's Prayer doesn't begin with 'Almighty God'.
The Lord's Prayer doesn't begin with 'Lord of all'.

questions.text: How does the Lord's Prayer begin?

options.explanation: False - Jesus taught about persistence in prayer.
Jesus taught that we should be persistent in prayer, using the parable of a friend at midnight.

questions.text: True or False: Jesus taught that we should only pray once for something and then stop asking.

options.explanation: Jesus taught against meaningless repetition, not against all repetition in prayer.
Jesus warned against meaningless repetition ('babbling'), not all repetition. Meaningful repetition can be appropriate.

questions.text: True or False: Jesus taught that all repetition in prayer is wrong.

options.explanation: Jesus taught that the humble tax collector who recognized his sinfulness was justified, not the proud Pharisee.
The Pharisee's prayer was self-righteous, focusing on his own good deeds.

questions.text: In Jesus' parable of the Pharisee and the tax collector praying in the temple, who went home justified before God?

title: Jesus' Teachings on Prayer
